executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on small caps, international equities, and value stocks, particularly energy. He emphasizes the importance of looking beneath the surface of the market, where significant opportunities for doubles and triples exist. He highlights Alibaba as a key holding and discusses the potential for Intel due to government support and partnerships with Nvidia. He also points out the undervaluation of energy stocks and their role as a pick-and-shovel play on AI.

key_reasons: Small caps are breaking out after 967 days since the last all-time high.
Bearish sentiment is unbelievably high, which is not typical at market tops.
Weaker dollar benefits international equities and small caps.
Consumer sentiment is at lows, indicating a buy opportunity.
Liquidity versus yield curve is about to change, which will benefit stocks.

macro_thesis_summary: The market is in the early stages of a bull market, with significant opportunities beneath the surface. Small caps, international equities, and value stocks are poised to outperform. A weaker dollar and declining interest rates will further fuel growth. The key is to focus on fundamentals and avoid chasing overvalued tech stocks.

Comstock Resources.thesis_summary: Comstock Resources is a natural gas producer with a best-in-class cost structure and strong growth potential due to rising demand from data centers. Management is bullish on 2026 and has no intention of issuing equity.
key_metrics: Natural gas and oil sales reached $344 million in Q2, up 24% year-over-year.
Production costs average 80 cents per MCFE, giving a 74% cash margin.
Management expects drilling efficiencies to further reduce DNC costs.
New partnership with Nextera Energy to explore gas-fired power generation assets near the western Hannesville aimed at serving potential data center customers.

National Oilwell Varco.thesis_summary: National Oilwell Varco is an energy equipment company with a rock-solid balance sheet and a commitment to returning capital to shareholders. Management expects offshore to return to growth and reacelerate in 2026.
key_metrics: Energy equipment segment generated revenue of $1.21 billion during the quarter.
Backlog for capital equipment orders stands at $4.3 billion.
Management announced a companywide cost reduction initiative targeting more than $100 million in annual savings by the end of 2026.
